review:
[b] PLEASE LISTEN TO THOSE NEGATIVE REVIEWS!!! [/b]

I got the game for 22p AND I have requested a refund. 

You ain't getting my pennies Mr. Scammer! It's not even worth it for the trading cards. 

Twice I tried to 'Start' the game from the main menu and twice the game froze my PC - even my cursor wouldn't move. I had to wait 10 minutes each time before it just closed. I've never had that happen before in my life. I've played a lot shit games during my time and usually you can just Alt-F4 or if it freezes, terminate it via the Task Manager. But not even that was possible. This game froze my PC completely. 

[i] 'Minutes feel like days while waiting for something to happen.' [/i] Yeah, that's pretty fucking accurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1705775182}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
It's shite; unplayable shite.  I let this sucker idle to earn trading cards, but the actual game goes to a black screen and there's nothing to be done about it (check other steam reviews, I'm certainly not alone).  I got it in a bundle for less than a buck, and I still feel ripped off.

Avoid like air-borne syphillis.

NOT recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1493363750}
review:
Magdalena is a horror game, where you relive your deepest and darkest memories.

Story:

You play as George, he is going through his old home and is reliving his old memories by exploring the house. The more you explore the house the more backstory you get and sinister truth is revealed to you.

Now I took the story description from the store page, but if this description wasn't there, it would be impossible to actually follow the story ( mostly because of a few factors, but we will get to those later). The story itself is not that interesting and a few notes pretty much giveway the plot twist ending, which is incredibly predictable. 

Graphics:

Magdalena is an asset flip game. The entire house you explore is called Residential House and you can buy it off the asset store. It's been used in so many horror games, if you would take a shot everytime you saw the same house, in a horror game you would die. 

Most recently this map was used in a video game called House Party, but there the map actually feels like things were added on top to make it feel like an actual house, here there's none of that. It overall looks good, but since it's a stock map, I won't give them points for the graphics. 

Audio:

Everything about the audio design is forgettable. The voice acting is pretty bad and with the echoy design it's hard to understand what the characters are saying. Other than that, the music and sound effects are really bland.

 You can hear crickets chirping and a fire place burning almost constantly, which after some time get's annoying, because you will explore the house for a long time and hearing the same thing over and over again will drive you insane. 

Gameplay:

In Magdalena all you do is walk around and relive the memories of George by reading notes. This overall doesn't seem that bad for a short experience, but the game is totally unplayable. The game takes roughly 15 minutes to finish, but it will take much much longer. 

First of all the game is really buggy. If you get lucky and the game starts playing you will have issues trying to finish it the entire time, because of constant gamebreaking bugs. One of the first ones you encounter is constant crashing. It feels like every so often the game will crash, but if you manage to get the good RNG, you won't encounter a lot of crashing, but however you will encounter other bigger bugs.

One of the bigger ones is a soft lock that will force you to replay the entire game all over again  and even then there's no guarantee the final note will spawn so you can finish the game. I did three runs before the game actually decided to spawn the final note. I can't even tell you what causes the bug, but all I know you have to get down on your knees and beg to every God and hope all the planets are aligned correctly for it to happen. 

Verdict:

Magdalena is an awful game, that is barely functional, the dev himself said the game is broken beyond fixing and did nothing about it and the fact the game is still up on steam and they are charging money for it is awful. I've also heard some people say the game bricks their PCs so that is a fair warning before heading into this game. Just save your money and buy something else. 

Pros:
N/A

Cons:
- Game breaking bugs make the game unplayable 
- The entire house is a stock map 
- Awful audio design 

Final Rating:
1/10

If you liked this review please consider joining https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198082881386', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1520893421}
review:
This game is really empty.
I don't know how couple of books scattered around can cause such enormous lag. Maybe it's light?
Add to that weird shadows, badly made interactions and a lot of other stuff that I don't want to remember - and you have clear example of someone learning how to use unity engine. I mean - it's a good thing to learn new stuff but selling unfinished and unpolished product is unacceptable.

Story could be good. But it looks like a draft, not full plot. A lot of wasted potential here.

Also according to most topics in discussions - I should consider myself luckie because I was able to launch the game!

Don't waste your money on this "gem".

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1512205211}
review:
[h1] Spiel: [/h1]

Ein klassischer Walking Simulator wo man wieder Zettel suchen darf.

[h1] Einzelspieler: [/h1]

Man steht vor seinem Haus und geht hinein, man durchsucht das Haus und findet Zettel mit Nachrichten. Im Haus selbst sind alle SchrÃ¤nke verbarrikadiert. Auf einem Bett sitzt eine Puppe die sich von allein Bewegt und den Schrank ankuckt.
Weiter bin ich nicht gekommen.

 [h1] Grafik: [/h1]

Die Grafik ist nicht besonders nur sehr dunkel oder viel zu hell. Aber selbst fÃ¼r 2016 nicht mehr besonders.

[h1] Musik: [/h1]

Die Musik ist auch nicht besonders, wenn es denn welche gab. 

[h1] Steuerung: [/h1]

Die Steuerung ist sehr langsam und Ungenau.

[h1] Pro/Contra: [/h1]

- Kein Cursor Lock 
- keine Hilfe
- keine deutsche Ãœbersetzung

[h1] Fazit: [/h1]

Keine Ahnung was man in diesem Spiel machen soll, aber es interessiert mich dann doch nicht so sehr. Das Spiel hat nichts was man nicht schon gesehen hat oder sehen will. Kann jedem nur abraten 1,49â‚¬ dafÃ¼r zu bezahlen.

[h1] Zusammengefasst: [/h1]

Einzelspieler: 0/10
Grafik: 3/10
Musik: 1/10
Steuerung: 3/10
----------------------------
Wertung: 2/1

author: {'steamid': '76561198091808820', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1510625974}
review:
another huge & juicy pile of horsesh#te. 

i tried to launch the game 11 times. one crash when loading the main menu and 10 crashes when trying to start a new game.
restarted my gaming rig and checked the game files with steam but nothing helped. i even tried starting the russian version but it keeps crashing and crashing and crashing.



yet i recall playing this game for like 20 minutes about a year ago on my old gaming rig. 
but even then it was really poor by any standard. even if you don't have any standards! 
one single house in the middle of nowhere filled with some generic & sterile  unity engine assets and still it ran at 15 fps for absolutely no f#cking reason at all.
and it was an absolute borefest even though i didn't get very far.

so i guess it's sort of a good thing that i can't play it anymore.
still a piece of sh#t though.
just let me get the trading cards and then clean  this malware off my machine.

review:
Warning, at its current state this application is nothing but Malware. It freezed your computer and won't let you terminate it unless you know how to taskkill forcefully.

The developer admitted that this game is broken (see link below) 9 MONTHS ago, and yet charges money for it, seemingly unwilling to fix it. Please do NOT buy the game, but report it as malicious software and/or fraud.


See here: http://steamcommunity.com/app/432470/discussions/0/361798516944603419/

author: {'steamid': '76561198060277415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1493472593}
review:
Magdalena is a game that I can't recommend because:
- it's not worth the money
- it has no subtitles
- you can't rebind the buttons
- the controls are horrible
- it has big FPS drops
- there is nothing horror/scarry in it
- it is boring
- the graphics aren't that good
- the soundtrack is pretty bad
- it looks more like an unfinished game
- the only good reason to install this game is for the trading cards

author: {'steamid': '76561198038373540', 'num_games_owned': 3539, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1487991620}
review:
If your rig have trouble to run Crysis 3 then beware-this unfinished small house is hungry for even more PC power.
But since we talk about around 200 square meters of game area (whole game), results are terrible.
Maybe is some eternal loop hidden by dev somewhere in house and that eat resources?
Who knows...

To conclude: this is not game, just some empty clueless space.
Everything is broken, achievements for sure.
Not even horror, nothing.
Empty shell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027964961', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1483877227}
review:
Zu dem Spiel ansich kann ich nichts sagen, da ich garnicht erst soweit komme!
Das spiel startet, dann kommt die Unity Werbung und danach ein BlackScreen mit einer Crash-Meldung.
Beim zweiten starten hing sich das Programm in der Unity Werbung auf!

Bis das behoben wurde gibts einen Daumen runter, tut mir leid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347260637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1480178410}
review:
For the price the game is pretty decent: graphics are great, it's nice that you can interact with every object, and the storyline is fine (at least to the point I managed to get). 

On the other side: it's super dark outside - I can't see a damn thing. Also some intro explaining the storyline would be nice, but there isn't any.

But my biggest issue is that the game runs really slow, even if my computer meets the system requirements (according to my son who helped with this. He also told me to turn off some settings in the game, but it didn't help).

If the creators of this game made some kind of new version, or improvements, then this would be a pretty good game. In the meantime, I will give Magdalena a little recommendation for its graphics and storyline!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996890045', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1487734567}
review:
Magdalena looks to be an interesting bit of artwork.
It is basically a walking game, where you walk around a house (inside and outside) and explore.
It includes a story in notes, contained in three notes to be found around the house.

I think that, for most people, it would be boring; but I found it somewhat interesting.
If you are looking for an "arty" experience, then this may be worth getting.

When the achievements are fixed, Magdalena would be worthwhile buying for any achievement hunters on Steam, but only if it is on sale for about 50 cents or $1 (currently, it is being sold on Steam for $2.99).

I can't give this game a high recommendation, but it just scrapes by.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262864341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1476597242}
review:
Wouldn't run on my Win 10 Alienware Alpha.  It was even hard to idle it for cards because it runs, hangs (alt tab works sort of, but will not actually switch), and had to reboot to get control back (start > power > restart).  But it does technically idle while hung, so I could get my trading cards.  On my 2nd attempt, I got it at least to accept the "Rus Eng" choice, then loaded indefinitely, and Alt + Tab shows a crash report.  In the end I could alt+tab to the crash window (although nothing pictured), hit enter, and it accepted the hidden dialog and I was back on my desktop.  What an adventure :) .

I honestly only got it for trading cards, which it did deliver.  But it was the hardest way to get trading cards of any of the junk games I've bought for trading cards :) .

author: {'steamid': '76561198109323439', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1703977427}
review:
Dopo  questa esperienza strana, mi viene naturale recensire Magdalena, non voglio essere negativa, perÃ² vorrei far capire agli autori come si sente una persona  digiuna completamente 
di ciÃ² che lâ€™aspetta. 
 Cominciamo col dire che non Ã¨ un vero gioco interattivo, nel senso che: non cÃ¨ una trama, non avete inventario, non unirete oggetti, non troverete  persone, nÃ© dialogherete, semplicemente esplorerete una casa.
Appena lanciate il gioco si presenta il menÃ¹, selezionate la lingua, new game e vaÃ¬Ã¬Ã¬Ã¬  si inizia!! 
Magari!!  Vi troverete di fronte a uno schermo nero, senza capire cosa fare, cliccate un po' in giro  nulla! Le frecce?  Manco! Alla fine provando con W finalmente riuscite  a muovervi EvvivÃ !E potete raggiungere quelle piccole luci in lontananza, verso il  piccolo tutorial finalmente ! 
Devo dire che come inizio Ã¨ abbastanza frustrante, perchÃ© di solito ci sentiamo sperduti quando incominciamo un nuovo game e desideriamo essere guidati, presi per mano quasi per farci sentire che il gioco, ci rassicura ci coccola, non sembra ma i primi minuti di un gioco come anche in un film sono fondamentali, ci viene spontaneo giudicarlo subito, se lâ€™inizio Ã¨ buono ci carichiamo se no ci smontiamo .
Aggiungerei anche  che si sente la mancanza di un puntatore vero proprio una bella freccia davanti che ci   
Indica dove stiamo guardando, invece vi troverete  solo un puntino piccolo, quasi impercettibile 
che dovete con attenzione passare sugli oggetti  solo per osservarli. 
 IL vostro compito sarÃ  quello di ricostruire la storia di Magdalena raccogliendo vari appunti sparsi per tutta la casa e il giardino, solo che dovete fare questo usando un certo ordine altrimenti non appariranno, con il rischio di girare inutilmente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011726692', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1469797994}
review:
EDIT:

Ok, nothing changes after half a year and as I see a lot of people have the same problem. Looks like developers don't give a damn about their game what is so sad. Steam should remove that game from their shop. These developers are just taking money from buyers don't mind if they have any issues with this "masterpiece". Don't waste your money.

___________________________________


OK, I'm done. I have no experience of a plot, graphic or anything else that game provided. Why? I can't play. When I'm trying the following issues may appear:

- black screen of death
- unable to click anything
- unable to close the game (only thing I can do is hard reset)
- experience crashing of resolution and then I'm unable to even shut down the laptop

Oh, before someone starts to be curious - my laptop is new and shiny with Windows 10 operating system. Sadly I can't make a complaint because I waited too long in hope that something will change. Such a pity.

If something will change (hopefully for better), maybe before another patch, I will edit this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046674658', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1469169584}
review: My god what a game. At first I was annoyed by the poor illumination that the lighter gave but... it's a lighter it's obvious it's not the best font of light right. The ambience is good. The pitch black outsides is kind of frightening even on the house while I was opened doors or switching lights I felt like something was going to jump on me any moment. The game is short, but the story is good enough and the ending gave me the chills. Oh and it has trading cards that are worth the games price on sale or even more. I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1466847663}
review:
So basically you are very old half blind vampire, you have no reflection and you are walking very very slowly, your eyes are so bad that when you lit lighter it only can lit wall you touching with your nose. When you pick up something you are to weak to move so you must put it back to be able to walk again. From time to time you can hear some woman babbling something in a distance or in your old head but your hearing or your head is in such a bad shape you can't understand much. If there was option to read that text you probably couldn't do that either because your old eyes are not fit for the task so it is good that there is no such option.

Save yourself that experience of being dying vampire and try something else, choose blindly you can't do much worse that this :)

review: Highly disappointed with this game. Not only is it quite buggy, but the mouse sensitity can't be changed and it is permanently on high, meaning the slightest move of the mouse means you turn drastically - precision is right out the window. "Press E to interact with everything" except for several things, "Press L to use Lighter" that doesn't work - one big frustrating mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126417780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1462540678}
review:
Don`t look at the pretty pictures offered by steam...This game is unspeakable abommination of a "game". You will start with directly FPS drop. Unplayable at 8 Cores I7 Intel and GTX 980m 4 GB, and 16 GB Ram. Beat this game! Witcher 3 - on ULTRA (w/o Nvidia Hairworks) goes constantly at 50-60 Hz, as for this garbage... well buy it and try it! Didn`t I mention it`s russian? Oh, well there are really good russian games for example Metro series...but this crap of a "game" is not worthy even of reviewing it!

P.S. Even the developers tried to report me for expressing my honest point of view... PATHETIC!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1462320819}
review:
"Magdalena" ist ein kleines First-Person Exploration Game.

Viel zur Story zu sagen verbietet sich, denn die ist im Wesentlichen das, was es zu entdecken gilt. Alles spielt vor und in einem Haus. Nachrichten sind zu finden, TÃ¼ren zu Ã¶ffnen, Dinge zu begutachten. Dabei kann man mit einigen, aber bei weitem nicht mit allen Objekten interagieren.

Manche Objekte wie Sofas oder Tische lassen sich auch verschieben, was dazu fÃ¼hrt, daÃŸ bÃ¶se Zungen "Magdalena" auch als UmrÃ¤umsimulator bezeichnen kÃ¶nnten.

Die Grafik ist hochrealistisch und grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils beeindruckend. Allerdings geht diese Grafikpracht merklich auf die Performance. Immer wieder stottert das Game, und das auch in niedrigeren Einstellungen. Die Optimierung ist einfach nicht besonders. 

Nach einigen anderen Spielen muÃŸ ich feststellen: genau dasselbe Haus ist mir mitlerweile schon in mehreren anderen Games begegnet. Also muÃŸ ich annehmen, es handelt sich anscheinend um ein Standard Unity-Asset Pack und ist keine Leistung des Entwicklers.

Eigentlich ist die AtmosphÃ¤re in dem nÃ¤chtlich verlassenen kleinen Haus richtig gut, die spÃ¤rlich gesetzten Sounds funktionieren. 
Eigentlich ist die Geschichte richtig gut geschrieben. Die Textschnipsel sind zwar nicht zahlreich, aber dafÃ¼r jeweils umfangreich und treffend.
Eigentlich ist die Immersion gut gesetzt und intelligent gebaut. Die Grundstimmung des Games wirkt erwachsen.

Das Anstrengende sind die technischen Probleme, die fehlende Optimierung, die auftretenden Bugs wie nicht mehr funktionierenden Eingaben. Oder auch die Inkonsequenz und fehlende Logik, daÃŸ man mit einigen Dingen interagieren kann, mit Ã¤hnlichen anderen aber nicht. All das reiÃŸt einen immer wieder aus dem Erlebnis raus, Ã¤rgert und nervt und lÃ¤ÃŸt einem wenig Chance, sich wirklich in die kleine Geschichte reinzuversetzen.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
5/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
4/10 Spielmechanik
4/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Viel Stoff, aber wenig Wolle. (hÃ¤tte Fontane gesagt)

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198112821720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1462011096}
review: The stuttering on this game is so bad, I couldn't even play it. It was a punt at Â£0.36 but I'm still disappointed I couldn't even navigate my way into the house!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014069772', 'num_games_owned': 8634, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1460681307}
review:
I'm not really sure why this game has so many positive reviews...
If you want to make a short artsy game with some sort of story, fine. 

BUT...
-The game no longer starts correctly, and I can no longer play it.  It boots, asks "Rus or Eng?" when I click Eng the screen goes black.  I can hear music, but the screen remains black.  I have tried revalidating the files and uninstalling it multiple times, but the problem persists.
-The one time I was able to play, it stuttered like mad, even with no antialiasing, lowest graphics settings, etc, even though I have a GTX 960, a newer Intel Core I-5 and 8 GB of ram
-The game claims that you can "Interact" with everything in the house.  While "Interacting" in this case just means picking things up(And not being able to move while doing so) and then putting them back down in the same place.  This doesn't really accomplish anything.
-The lighter that you use illumnates almost nothing, making it difficult to navigate dark places, which is a lot of the map.
-The grammar is awful.  I know this is not a gameplay critique, but the only elements of story are found on notes throughout the house.  It makes it difficult to understand the story when it seems like somebody just copied a note in Russian, pasted it into google translate, and used whatever came out without checking if it even made sense.
-Taking a look at the achievements and seeing that  0.9% of people have any of them, basically means that none of them work.  (The only people who have them are people that hack steam achievements)

(My Opinion)
-Overall, Not very motivated to continue playing the game/not sure what to do/not sure if there is even an ending

author: {'steamid': '76561197998726931', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1514912233}
review:
EDIT 02/01/18:

One year later, I thought I would try again.  Oh how excited I was as the game actually booted to the menu, maybe I could play the game again.  Of course I couldn't, the game will crash on the loading screen and take your computer hostage so it takes quite some effort to kill it and regain controll of your PC.  We can only hope the  remake that the poor unsuspecting Steam Greenlight Community (RIP) voted for and greenlit never arrives, or there will be many more unhappy customers in future.  Don't even buy this on sale, it is at best literally unplayable, at worst malware.  

I also  found it amusing that within an hour of originally posting this review back when the game was new, I had three "Unhelpful" downvotes.  Clearly the Developer doesn't like bad reviews and uses multiple accounts to try and bury them.  Upstanding and honest behaviour that goes hand in hand with this wonderful attrocity.

---

EDIT 04/01/17:

It's worth updating just to let people know I've made a few attempts to come back to this game, but the developers seem intent on not letting anyone play it anymore and it won't boot at all.  Now they have a re-release version of it on Steam Greenlight trying to trick us into giving them votes again (I will admit to voting for them on Greenlight for this one) so they can sell it again under a slightly updated name.  The horror.

---

Once upon a midnight dreary, I was feeling bright and cheery, 
Until some technical problems I abhor.
While I nodded in anticipation, the game it crashed, oh damnation, 
Met with errors, crashing, crashing, what a chore.
"T is some glitch," I muttered, "I'll try some more,"
But appeared this way for evermore.

Ah distinctly I complained about this failure of a game,
But long it lingered in my brain, I felt the need to play some more.
Eagerly I held my patience until the game it was updated,
"No more crashes", in sorrow I implored.
I clicked my mouse, the game it soared,
And displayed madness at the fore.

---

I initially bought this game when it was first released.  In my very brief playtime, the game repeatedly crashed at start-up.  In the two occasions I actually got into the game, once my mouse locked up in the settings menu unable to alter anything until the game crashed completely.  The other time I went straight into the game, getting about 1-2 FPS.  I believed my system was capable of handling this game with a GeForce GTX 970 and 16GB RAM, but alas, it was not to be.  I got a refund and that was that.
  
Nonetheless, I kept thinking about the game, wishing I could have experienced it, and then I saw it again, on sale for Â£0.36, at that price I could hardly say no, it was worth seeing if it had been fixed.

The technical problems I suffered are all gone, Iâ€™m happy to confirm Iâ€™m now running the game smoothly with all the settings maxed out, I knew my set-up could handle it.  This is the sort of game made for me, I love the writings of Edgar Allan Poe, I love games like Gone Home which give me a place to fully explore at my will.  But perhaps this game works better in the native Russian language.  It is clear the developers are trying hard, but the English translation is so bizarre I just canâ€™t quite work out what the writing is trying to convey half the time. The quality of the writing is the key factor of a game such as this, when that doesnâ€™t work, youâ€™re just left to explore without any real sense of purpose or immersion.

The developers have an interesting sense of humour, Iâ€™m sure there is a joke Iâ€™m missing about the fork next to the toilet.  I donâ€™t understand it, but itâ€™s still funny on a simple visual level.  Also the physics on the chest of drawers are pretty special, just pick them up and move them around like theyâ€™re in zero gravity, itâ€™s quite novel in what is supposed to be a dark and moody game. 

The big issue for me though, is that the game entirely lacks an Invert Mouse option, which is simply unacceptable.  This can easily be patched in, but for a game claiming to be a release build and not an Early Access preview, this is inexcusable, especially as it has been out for some time now and has still not being implemented.  When basic essentials are missing from a game, you have to seriously question what is going on at the development end.  I'll happily edit this once (or if?) this essential feature is patched in.  But two months after the alleged release build was made available on Steam, I don't have high hopes.

From an objective perspective, this game is not good and I cannot possibly recommend it.  But from a subjective personal perspective, I find it all quite entertaining.  If you want something competent, maybe look elsewhere.  If youâ€™re happy to take a chance on a game that will utterly confuse and amaze you with unintended craziness, you could do a lot worse.  I'm going to go back in now and see what else I can do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267148145', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1515086423}
review:
[strike]This game has a lot to go for but as an indie it failed in many things

-It's poorly coded: I can't even play it just because it automaticly displays in 4K when i've got my windows set to 1366x768, and there's no way that I can downscale it without another monitor.
-Even after some problems regarding the crossover to Ue4, the support for it is realy low

And lastly to Yellow Bun Studio:

This game is dead, you should not care about it anymore, so if you want to still be on the indie market you're gonna need a hit tittle, and for those regards im here to help.

Just push a little bit more of imagination and work on either a sequel (which i don't recomend after seeing this flop) or on an original story that catches the eye of everyone.[/strike]

[b](edit 2022: Nah forget what I typed, this was nothing but a glorified demo made from flipped assets, I've seen powerpoint presentations more worthy of the title of "game". This should be removed from the steam store simply for the fact that it's nothing but a stinking turd on steam. There's ZERO effort put into this demo. In case someone sees this "game" while searching the store, don't even bother, you'd get more value and fun opening a TF2 case)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198171314747', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1485385414}
review:
I really don't know how this got any good reviews. Let me give you a list of everything wrong with this game.
The English translation is terrible.
Your player movement is comparable to a slug.
No matter how good of a computer you have, this game will shutter like crazy.
The goal of the game is not clear
The entire game is covered in blackness unless you find some lights. (Its so dark I found it very difficult to know where I was going half the time)
The locations of the keys are terrible and will sometimes not appear (You need keys to open some doors)
I used a key to open a drawer and there was nothing inside it. [Glicth example]
The only music I heard was in the title screen. (granted I could not finish the game because I could not find the last key to open the last locked door. and there are no guides explaining where its location is).
In short, this game is terrible. Don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1460281347}
review:
This game has a great idea behind it.. why oh why couldn't it have been developed by a proper competent developer?

The game claims that almost all things can be interacted with, this is far from true.
And the actual interaction system is horrible, you don't pick stuff up and look at it and move it around in your hand like you'd expect, you drag it across the floor, you drag a magazine or a cup across the floor.

The movement in the game is bad, and the lighter to give you some light is so weak that I had to look at my keyboard to make sure I pressed the correct button then I looked down at my feet in-game and saw a spec of light.

No subtitles, no key-rebinding. And why is the flashlight(lighter) bound to the button L? Why not T or Q or something closer to the rest of the buttons.
Horrible, absolutelly horrible performance. I have a pretty damn strong PC and I was lagging all over and my FPS was in the ground, I had to turn everything to the worst setting to be able to play without ripping my hair out.

The game tries to be scary, it tries to be some sort of horror but fails.
The only scary thing if you really want it to be scary is the vocie of a woman talking, and her voice is extremely low, if you want to be able to make out any words then you'll have to turn your windows volume WAY up which will make you deaf as there is no in-game volume sliders, so all other sounds will probably blast your eardrums out.

This game is simply unfinished. I don't.. I can't phatom why this was released as a finished product when it's clearly not. Why not just wait until it's finished or at least put it in early access.
I'm really sad that this game got released so early, I bet if this game was released when it was actually finished, you know, when the game is playable performance-wise, when you've finished the options menu, it would've been so much better but now you've tainted everyone with a bad experience to this game.

I can only assume that most of the positive reviews where for a CD-Key to the game or something. No one in their right mind would rate this game good.

And by the way I'm pretty sure that the developers or something are going around disliking all negative reviews because as far as I can see most negative reviews instantly get like 2 or 3 dislikes.

Edit: And yea, I almost instantly got 2 downvotes, cool.


[h1]Curator page[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or otherwise found it helpful in deciding whether or not to buy this game, feel free to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29162366/]my Curator page[/url].[/i]

review: First "game" I have requested a refund on, and I got it for 75% off.  For me it was to make a point, this should not be on steam.  Especially for money! author: {'steamid': '76561198053757623', 'num_games_owned': 3175, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1459397338}
review:
Not playable. I got 70-100fps in BF4 on ultra and 25-40 here. Physics are broken and it is hard to use objects/doors and also dark as hell. You have a lighter but it lights up only ground under your feet and objects 1-2 steps in front of you which doesn't help much.
But I must admit graphics in home are very good and textures looks pretty high res, good work here. This time you really get what you see on screenshots, no fake here. But game needs a lot of optimisation and normal lighter/flashlight or at least Brightness options (which is obvious btw) for outdoor exploring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995424580', 'num_games_owned': 1231, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1462394386}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976235978', 'num_games_owned': 1923, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1457692579}
review:
This game is not finished.
There is nothing wrong with that, that's what early access is for, but this game is sold as a finished product, and it is not.

Collisions are bad, graphic optimization is bad, text scroller do not reset, no text to tell you to press E to read things, doors will sometime close right after you open them and get too close, lighter is so weak that i thought it didn't work until i looked at my feet, english translation is not so good, no subtitles, etc.

This game looks promising, but it is not finished and came out as a release too soon. I hope devs will fix all the problems but until then, i can't rate it positively.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110483386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1457630055}
review: Could be interesting, if it wasn't so horribly laggy (in a Windows 8 laptop that can run much bigger games without any problems). Also, the lagging causes a lot of jerks, which in turn are causing motion sickness, so at least for me, this game is unplayable. Played about 30 minutes before giving up and leaving it running for long enough to get the cards. At least I got this in a bundle, so I didn't pay full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172259757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1458224031}
review:
Edit: Looks like they are slowly updating things, so this review may or may not be relevant. They seem to care about making the game polished.

This would be ok if it was free [strike], and was optimized. I assume it is either some kind of effect, or badly optimized physics asset (in Unity), but the game stutters a lot, and makes it nearly unplayable (On a decent system). [/strike] (Game runs OK now. Not great... but it's playable). There are still a lot of issues, and honestly, and I only realize that now that I can play it with better performance.

The game itself starts off like a [spoiler]horror, but itsn't at all. It has a scary voice, and background noises, so you think something will jump out. [/spoiler]

It should also warn you that there is no save. 

Honestly, this feels like someone took a few Unity assets and mashed them together in a way that looks beautiful,  [strike]but doesn't at all mesh well[/strike] but meshes together only ok. [strike]Absolutely NOT ready for free or pay. I'll recommend this once the performance is better.[/strike]. ****At least put this game in early access / alpha. This is ridiculous***

Some more issues:
-Turning on the lights is a bit of a chore. When you point at a light, the dialog should come up... but sometimes you have to fish for it.
-Turning items around in 3D when picking them up is not clear... should be instructions. 
-I got stuck in the bedroom, inside the walking closet. The chair fell back and trapped me in, and there's no jump option. So I closed out immediately.
-Would be nice if there was a symbol that popped up over an item so you know you're centered on it... like Dreamfall Chapters, or Life is Strange.
- At the beginning it says press "E" to look, but that doesn't do anything, and seems like the character looks before you do that

It just isn't polished yet.

review: This is pretty attractive little game if you look the graphics, but needs to be polished in some details. Before you start playing I recommend to disable SSR setting, otherwise you may experience some troubles with light and textures. Also, when the game starts you get a black screen which is actually night, but you might think this some freeze or bug, just need to turn around and see the light
